text.name: sys_description
text.text: The SG-1000 is the first game console produced by Sega and released in Japan on July 15, 1983. It was released at the same time as the SC-3000 computer, which is compatible with all its applications and games. By adding a keyboard it can be used as a computer and with an adapter cartridge it can read the 'Sega My Card' game cards. It is equipped with a Zilog Z80 8bits 3.58 MHz processor, 4 KB of RAM and is able to display up to 16 colors. Its game library has 29 Sega My Card games and 68 cartridge games, 26 of which require the keyboard connection.
